title: Drawing, George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Bathroom, May 21, 1934
title_raw: George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Bathroom
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/145 WEST 57TH STREET/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 520-9/1"-1'0"/RAND, WEST./ 5/21/34, 5/21/34, 3/8/14/34, 8/14/34, 4/ 8/30/34, 8/30, 4; inscribed in graphite, upper center: BATHROOM/ STUDIO 46 WASHINGTON MEWS; inscribed in graphite above stamp: SCHEDULE/TOILET RELOCATED/NEW BIDET INSTALLED/FURRED CEILING & TUB SOFFIT/REMOVE LAVATORY/NEW LAVATORY INSTALLED/NEW RADIATOR & ENCLOSURE/REMOVE TUB/INSTALL NEW TUB/REMOVE EXISTING PLASTER DADO/AND REPLASTER/GOLD LEAF CEILING & SOFFIT/WHITE RUBBER TILE FLOOR/REMOVE PIPE CHASE/MIRRORS ON TUB ALCOVE WALLS/ELECTRIC OUTLETS/PATCH FLOOR BEFORE LAYING RUBBER/TILE FLOORING/CABINET WOODWORK & GLASS/SHELVES/LINOWALL WALLS; dimensions, materials, and instructions in graphite
description: Plans and elevations for bathroom. Entrance to bathroom on upper right wall; rectangular sink with rounded edges on right wall near door. Vanity mirror above sink with built in medicine cabinet with mirror front and gold-plated frame; glass shelf. Vertical and rectangular light at left and right of mirror. Radiator below window on far wall; hamper to the left of window. Bidet on upper left wall with paper holder to left of bidet. Toilet to left of bidet; white rubber tile floor below. New tub on near wall with shower head mounted on wall; mirrored wall behind tub. Linoleom walls with wood molding near ceiling.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Bathroom, May 21, 1934. Graphite on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite. 
Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-530
